PM mata ex-cunhado que descumpriu medida protetiva e foi visitar ex-namorada
Caso aconteceu no bairro Monte Serrat, em Salvador; PM se apresentou 
07 Nov 2019, 12:12 by Tailane Muniz
Eric dos Santos Queiroz, 23 anos, não aceitava o fim do relacionamento com a ex-namorada. Mesmo sabendo que a mulher estava amparada por uma medida protetiva que proibia que se aproximasse, decidiu procurar a jovem, na manhã de quarta-feira (6), no bairro de Monte Serrat, em Salvador.
Lá, chegou gritando e fazendo ameaças. Ao retornar para casa, foi agredido e baleado pelo ex-cunhado, um soldado da Polícia Militar que não teve o nome divulgado. Baleado na cabeça, Eric foi socorrido para o Hospital Agenor Paiva, no Caminho de Areia, mas precisou ser transferido para o Hospital Geral do Estado (HGE), onde morreu na manhã desta quinta-feira (7), por volta das 7h. 


Eric foi morto com tiro disparado por PM, irmão de sua ex-namoradaFoto: Reprodução/Tailane Muniz/CORREIO

Segundo ocorrência registrada no posto da Polícia Civil da unidade de saúde, Eric estava ciente da decisão judicial que determinou o afastamento da ex-namorada. “A irmã da vítima diz que ele recebeu a intimação que comunicava a medida protetiva, mas não conseguia aceitar a separação”. 

Leia também: 
‘Dei tanto conselho, mas estava apaixonado’, diz irmã de morto por cunhado PM

O documento diz ainda que, a princípio, o crime foi registrado como tentativa de homicídio pela delegada plantonista, Darlene Palafois, a ser investigado pela 3ª Delegacia (Bonfim). Após a morte, contudo, o caso está sob a investigação do Departamento de Homicídios e Proteção à Pessoa (DHPP).
A Polícia Civil informou, em nota, que a 3ª Delegacia de Homicídios (DH/BTS) investiga a morte de Eric. "A vítima foi socorrida para o Hospital Geral do Estado (HGE), onde não resistiu aos ferimentos. O suspeito é um policial militar e ex-cunhado da vítima", disse, em nota. 
O corpo de Eric, que segundo as informações preliminares estava desarmado, foi levado para o Instituto Médico Legal Nina Rodrigues (IMLNR), onde aguarda a identificação de familiares.
Segundo apurou o CORREIO, o PM se apresentou com a arma utilizada na Corregedoria da corporação.
Procurada pela reportagem, a Polícia Militar ainda não retornou contato.
text:
PM kills ex-brother-in-law who failed to comply with protective measure and went to visit ex-girlfriend
This happened in the Monte Serrat neighborhood of Salvador; PM introduced himself
07 Nov 2019, 12:12 by Tailane Muniz
Eric dos Santos Queiroz, 23, did not accept the end of his relationship with his ex-girlfriend. Even knowing that the woman was protected by a protective measure that forbade her to approach, decided to seek the girl, on Wednesday morning (6), in the neighborhood of Monte Serrat, in Salvador.
There he arrived shouting and making threats. Upon returning home, he was beaten and shot by his former brother-in-law, a military police soldier who was not named. Shot in the head, Eric was rescued to Agenor Paiva Hospital on the Sandy Road, but had to be transferred to the State General Hospital (HGE), where he died on Thursday morning at 7 am.


Eric was shot dead by PM, his ex-girlfriend's brotherPhoto: Reproduction / Tailane Muniz / MAIL

According to an incident recorded at the health unit's Civil Police post, Eric was aware of the court ruling that led to his ex-girlfriend's removal. "The victim's sister says he received the subpoena that communicated the protective measure, but could not accept the separation."

Read too:
"I gave so much advice, but I was in love," says sister of dead by brother-in-law PM

The document also says that, at first, the crime was registered as an attempted murder by the delegate on duty, Darlene Palafois, to be investigated by the 3rd Police Station (Bonfim). After death, however, the case is under investigation by the Department of Homicide and Protection of Persons (DHPP).
The Civil Police reported in a statement that the 3rd Homicide Police (DH / BTS) investigates Eric's death. "The victim was rescued to the State General Hospital (HGE), where he could not resist the injuries. The suspect is a military police officer and former victim's brother-in-law," he said in a statement.
Eric's body, which according to preliminary information was unarmed, was taken to the Nina Rodrigues Legal Medical Institute (IMLNR), where it awaits the identification of family members.
As the MAIL learned, the PM presented with the weapon used in the coregistry of the corporation.
Sought by the report, the Military Police has not yet returned contact.
